step1.title: Create a Project
step1.description:
To get started, create your first project. You only need to give it a name, indicate what stage it's in, and then define how you want to manage governance and finances within the team.

You can review each option in detail and adjust the configuration to match how your team works today. If something doesn't fit your current practices, let us know — we can help or prepare new configurations for your case.

step2.title: Invite Your Contributors
step2.description:
Once the project is created, the next step is to invite the people who are part of your team.

At any time, you can go to:
Avatar (top right) → My Projects → Select the project → Contributors

Enter the contributor’s email and we’ll send an automatic invitation. They’ll have three days to accept it, and once they do, they’ll appear in the list of active contributors.

step3.title: Integrate Your Management Tool
step3.description:
In the Integrations tab, you'll find the available options to connect your management tool, or you can vote for yours so we can prioritize it.

From here, you can:
- Install what's needed if the tool requires it.
- Register and authorize the connection.
- View the integration status.
- Sync data manually if something is out of date.

step4.title: View the Project’s Ownership Distribution
step4.description:
With the integration running, you can go to the Dashboard tab to see how ownership distribution evolves based on recorded contributions. You’ll also find key project metrics and your own activity.

This information helps the whole team organize its governance, agreements, and resource management in a more transparent and decentralized way.

We also recommend adopting a methodology that allows you to review and refine ownership management over time.
